title: DYING_S0UL
author: DYING_S0UL
content: I will try to keep it as short and simple as possible. I know there are many ranks and positions in Bitcointalk. Like newbie, Jr, member, full member Sr, hero, and lastly legendary. Also, there is donator and copper member, moderator, and global moderator. And there are those who are most trusted known as DT members. Lastly staff, administrator, and founder.I wanted to know the capabilities of these ranks and positions. If I say more specifically, I would like to know the difference between moderators, staff, and DT. These 3 position holds much influence in the forum. I want to know the extent of these positions. And who holds the power to ban a user? As far as I know, moderators are in charge of different boards for spam and illegal activities and reporting them and deleting them. I don't know what the staff does, maybe they check the reports and ban them. As for DT they are the most trusted members of the forum. Do they hold the same powers? Like banning somebody? What are their limits? Can a DT be staff or moderator and vice versa. As for the rest of the ranks, I know enough. I know it may sound like a stupid question but I created this thread anyway. It was just a curious mind question to know the forum and its members.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Here is an explanation of each role Quote from: Cyrus on June 18, 2013, 11:33:58 PMAll the main ranks that can be handed out to normal users are: Brand New, Newbie, Jr. Member, Member, Full Member, Sr. Member, Hero Member and Legendary.In addition to the main rankings, there are also sub-rankings that can be applied, and those are: Donator, and VIP.Finally, staff sub-rankings are as follows: Staff, Moderator, Global Moderator, Administrator, and Founder.RankDescriptionTagBrand New:0 posts, gets 1 gold coin under his name.Newbie:(none), gets 1 gold coin under his name.Jr. Member:Activity: 30, gets 1 gold coin under his name.Member:Activity: 60, gets 2 gold coins under his name.Full Member:Activity: 120, gets 3 gold coins under his name.Sr. Member:Activity: 240, gets 4 gold coins under his name.Hero Member:Activity: 480, gets 5 gold coins under his name.Legendary:Activity: the Legendary membergroup has no universal activity requirement.You are guaranteed to become Legendary somewhere between 775 and 1030 activity,but the exact point in this range at which you become Legendary is random per user.Gets 5 gold coins under his name of which the last is half dark blue.Sub-RankDescriptionTagDonator:Manually applied by administration after 10 BTC donation, and gets 5 gold coins under his nameof which the last is half green. 5 coins are shown regardless of post count when user is a Donator.VIP:Manually applied by administration after 50 BTC donation, and gets 5 gold coins under his nameof which the last is half purple. 5 coins are shown regardless of post count when user is a VIP.Staff RankDescriptionTagStaff:Shown when moderators (see next point) post outside of the sections that they moderate.The tags under their usernames are dependent on their post group.variableModerator:Shown when moderators of specific sections post within those sections.Gets 5 gold coins, of which the last is shown as half faded-out green.Global Moderator:Applied to Staff that have moderation privileges in all boards.Gets 5 gold coins, of which the last is half teal colored.Administrator:Has all available permissions and can appoint moderators and perform other administrative tasks.Gets 5 gold coins, of which the last is shown half red regardless of post count.Founder:Reserved for Satoshi, gets 5 platinum coins under his name.The way activity is calculated:Quote from: theymos on June 18, 2013, 08:44:42 PMThe activity number is determined in this way:time = number of two-week periods in which you've posted since your registrationactivity = min(time * 14, posts)Activity is updated every hour.To become a Donator or a VIP, send a PM to theymos to get a unique donation address.Took the liberty to update it according to the new Activity & new member limits/groups.Edited with proper number of coins.Edited to reflect OP.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Default trust is a list maintained by the website's administrator Theymos, which as the name suggests, is the default list everyone creating a new bitcointalk account will Â have. It's recommended however to create your own trust list based on your dealings with people in the forum. There are some rules Theymos has set for how an account ends up in DT which you can read here:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5095156.0And you can track and discuss updates in DT in the latest pages of that thread too.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: With the little knowledge I now possess of the forum, I could say that different ranks and titles in the forum carry different powers and functionality. This is evident in the benefits and functionality of the normal ranks from brand-new status to Legendary. Let me summarise the unusual ones aside from the founder since it's an obvious one. This is based on my little knowledge here though.Staff: Employees of the forum. They interpret the rules and will definitely relate often with Theymos and LoyceV about the forum.Moderators: As in all moderating forum functions.DT: Trusted users for tagging and feedback (positive/negative).Copper Membership: Bought membership that allows you to post images. It's a membership status that gives you the benefit of a member rank. (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2385104.msg24371150#msg24371150).

DT aren't the most trusted, DT 1 is gotten by appointment by theymos and they're selected from a number of members that met the DT requirements DefaultTrust changes. DT2 are those trusted by DT 1. You can be among those with the most trust feedback yet, you're not a DT 1 member. DT don't have power to ban anybody on the forum, they don't have administrative power to delete posts or do any thing. Consider them to be police of the forum as their feedback on your profile has a lot of weight. QuoteCan a DT be staff or moderator and vice versa. As for the rest of the ranks, I know enough.Yes anybody can be a DT member when they meet the requirements and a DT can also be a moderator/staff QuoteI know it may sound like a stupid question but I created this thread anyway. comments.author: hg_away
comments.body: In fact, in the past there was no member rank or legendary. The highest rank was hero member and everyone could wear an avatar. You can review the changes in the ranking system here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5170032.0Currently, there are members besides admins who can add people to the white list (proxy ban ) and members who are not mods but can delete posts for newbie rank only.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: From what I understand, moderators have the power to delete or move posts, but they do not have the power to ban members.Also, DT and DT1 do not have the power to ban members, but they can tag any profile and it will have a significant negative impact, but I do not think it will lead to banning the member later.As for banning members, I believe that this is within the powers of the Global Moderator and Administrator only. I do not know if I am wrong.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on October 07, 2023, 03:32:48 AMFrom what I understand, moderators have the power to delete or move posts, but they do not have the power to ban members.Moderators can not unban users. They have to file their reports to global moderators and admins who will consider unbanning a banned user and refusing to do it.Previously, only admins can unban users but it was changed since 2019 and after that global moderators have unban button too.Quote from: achow101 on May 14, 2019, 02:42:37 PMPosts are reported to moderators who check out the report. If the poster needs to be banned, the moderator sends a ban report up to a global mod or admin. The global mod or admin handles all of the ban reports they get at around the same time. Either the admins or global mods don't need to check every account because they trust the moderators to have already done so, or they check quickly because every such report contains references and links to the plagiarism post and to the source text so checking takes little time.Quote from: hilariousandco on May 15, 2019, 10:32:46 AMGlobal mods were given the ability to ban signatures only yesterday. Do you think we can get through all the appeals in one day? Be patient.
